text:
The following will not work:
SetEnv evh_lang=gr
SetEnvIf host ^opeportal-en evh_lang=en
SetEnvIf host ^www-en.kerasma evh_lang=en
SetEnvIf host ^www.kerasma.com evh_lang=en

SetEnvIf evh_lang gr vhlog_gr
SetEnvIf evh_lang en vhlog_en

vhlog_gr will never be set, only vhlog_en. It seems that SetEnvIf ignores SetEnv
variables. In order for this to work, first line should be:

SetEnvIf host ^[a-z] evh_lang=gr

which is not very nice.
creator: vladap@criticalpublics.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
Yes, this is because SetEnv sets variables much later. SetEnvIf runs directly
before the request is processed. The purpose of SetEnv is to set variables for
the content handler (e.g. a cgi script).
